variable.name: Geneva_ID_
variable.description: De-identified subject's ID

variable.name: Gender_
variable.description: Patient's gender
variable.comment: Derived from questionnaire for cases or controls

variable.name: case_control
variable.description: References if subject is a case or control

variable.name: Race_
variable.description: Patient's race [white]
variable.comment: Derived from questionnaire for cases or controls

variable.name: moles
variable.description: Indicator of the presence of moles

variable.name: dysplastic_nevi
variable.description: Indicator of the presence of dysplastic nevi

variable.name: skin_color
variable.description: Subjective grading of the skin color: 1=lightest; 10=Darkest. [How would you grade your skin color on a scale of 1 (very fair) to 10 (dark brown)? (Circle one)]

variable.name: eye_color
variable.description: Eye color

variable.name: hair_color
variable.description: Hair color

variable.name: sunburn
variable.description: Indicator of the presence of severe blistering before age 16

variable.name: freckle
variable.description: Indicator of freckling when out in the sun

variable.name: untanned
variable.description: Indicator on the presence of a tan after exposure to the sun for 30-40 minutes

variable.name: family_history
variable.description: Indicator of any cancer history in the 1st degree relatives (parents, siblings, children)
variable.comment: The "family_history" field is a concatenation of responses to questions 23-28 in which a positive response to cancer in any first degree relative is cited as being positive for family history of cancer.

variable.name: stage_cat
variable.description: Patient's stage at initial diagnosis including stage I, I/II, III, IV, and in-situ

variable.name: Age_at_DX
variable.description: Patient's age at diagnosis of melanoma

variable.name: State_
variable.description: Patient's State of residence including Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nebraska, New Jersey, New Mexico, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington, Wisconsin, Wyoming, or other

variable.name: Country_
variable.description: Patient's country of residence including Bolivia, Brazil, Canada, Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador, Turkey, United States, Uruguay, Venezuela, other, or unknown

variable.name: Control_Age_at_DX
variable.description: Patient's age as recorded

variable.name: Breslow_tumor_thickness
variable.description: The Breslow Thickness expressed in millimeters based on all MDACC [MD Anderson Cancer Center] pathology reviews
variable.value: Not applicable per pathology report for the lesion

variable.name: Clark_level
variable.description: The Clark Level based on all MDACC [MD Anderson Cancer Center] pathology reviews
variable.value: Clark level not stated on pathology report or there were not any prognostic factors available for the lesion

variable.name: Ulceration_
variable.description: Indicator of the presence of ulceration in the primary lesion
variable.value: Presence or absence was not stated in the lesions's pathology report
No prognostic factors were available or ulceration was inevaluable at time of pathology review

variable.name: Blood_Draw_Date_
variable.description: De-identified date of patient's blood draw
variable.comment: Derived from questionnaire for cases or controls

variable.name: Months_follow_up
variable.description: The months of follow up recorded from date of diagnosis to most recently recorded vital status follow up date.

variable.name: vital_status_
variable.description: Patient's vital status at the time the most current follow up was conducted [alive, dead]
